gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: General Command of Mapping, Department of BSDD

gmd:code.gmx:Anchor: Mean Sea Level at Antalya, Antalya Height

gmd:codeSpace.gco:CharacterString: Turkish Topographic Map Sheet Index, K816 Series
NATO Stock Number of the paper map of this sheet

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: On this topographic map, the natural and man-made features existing on the earth are represented with cartographic symbols in accordance with plotting scale and the topography is represented with 10 meters-interval contours.

gmd:textGroup.gmd:LocalisedCharacterString: Topoğrafik haritada, çizim ölçeğine uygun olarak; arazide mevcut doğal ve yapay detaylar kartoğrafik sembollerle, yeryüzü şekilleri (topoğrafyası) 10 metre aralıklı eş yükseklik eğrileri ile gösterilmiştir.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: Topographic map is used by defence organisations for various military purposes. It is also used by government and industry to assist with regional planning, infrastructure, environmental monitoring, emergency management, outdoor recreation etc. The raster map is mostly used as a background image for many purposes. The height or depth of the terrain, ie the shape and elevation of the landscape can be determined on the map.

gmd:specificUsage.gco:CharacterString: In order to convert the coordinates from WGS-84 to ED50; add 29 m. (1” to Longitude) to Easting and add 184 m. (3.5” to Latitude) to Northing. Find corresponding height value in the map by subtracting 35 m. from the Ellipsoidal Height in WGS-84 computed by GPS receivers.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: Croplands and the administrative boundaries other than international are not shown on this map.
This raster map contains a hidden digital identification information which proves to whom this map supplied.

All rights reserved. Whole or any part of this data may not be misused, reproduced, published, distributed or used as a base map, in any form or by any means without the prior written consent of the General Command of Mapping.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: The conversion from pdf to tiff was done by using Photoshop software and Global Mapper was used for the georeference process. All the works were done in the Windows environment.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: The raster map contains the legend and other usefull information on its' marginalia.

gmd:fileDecompressionTechnique.gco:CharacterString: The file is compressed by loseless LZW. It may require to decompress the file before use.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: usual method, performed by an operator

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: This measure provides the absolute horizontal accuracy of the data
This measure provides the absolute vertical accuracy of the data

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: The features were captured from stereo aerial photos by digital photogrammetric methods. Then the map was completed on the field on 2007-06-10 and produced a publication version of the map in pdf format after digital cartographic works. After that, the raster map was produced by converting the pdf file to tiff format with 300 dpi resolution and 24 bit-RGB colour model, following with georeference process. The bilinear interpolation method was used in the georeference process as a resampling method.

gmd:rationale.gco:CharacterString: This step was necessary to process the data
